plants.name: Rosa spp.
plants.description: Roses are woody perennial flowering plants known for their fragrant and beautiful blooms with layered petals. They are widely cultivated in gardens worldwide and come in many varieties and colors.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to early summer (May to June) in temperate regions
plants.location: Temperate regions of North America, Europe, and Asia
plants.funFact: Roses have been symbols of love and beauty for centuries, and rose oil is a valuable ingredient in perfumery.

plants.name: Aquilegia canadensis
plants.description: A wildflower native to eastern North America, this plant produces distinctive red and yellow flowers with long spurs, attracting hummingbirds and bees.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to early summer (May to June)
plants.location: Woodlands and rocky slopes in eastern North America
plants.funFact: The Eastern Red Columbine's flower shape evolved to adapt to pollination by hummingbirds.

plants.name: Lagerstroemia indica
plants.description: A deciduous shrub or small tree, crape myrtle is prized for its vibrant summer blooms and attractive, peeling bark. It thrives in warm climates.
plants.bloomingSeason: Early to late summer (June through September)
plants.location: Southeastern United States, Asia, and other warm temperate to tropical regions
plants.funFact: Crape myrtle flowers can bloom profusely during hot summers, adding vibrant color when many other plants fade.

plants.name: Nymphaea spp.
plants.description: Aquatic plants with broad floating leaves and showy flowers that bloom on calm freshwater surfaces. They open their flowers during the day in summer.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to summer (May to August)
plants.location: Temperate to tropical freshwater lakes and ponds worldwide
plants.funFact: Water lily flowers open and close with the sun's movement and can smell sweet to attract pollinators.
